Dorsal surface.gif){#fig-gray1918-image220} ![Scaphoid bone (left) @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Osteology/image221 The left navicular bone.gif){#fig-gray1918-image221} The scaphoid is part of the *proximal carpal row*. # Scaphoid stabilization - 1st factor: Direct ligamentous attachment - Scaphotrapeziual ligament @jonesProjectFoundations2025 - Scaphotrapezoidal ligament @jonesProjectFoundations2025 - Scaphocapitate ligament @jonesProjectFoundations2025 - 2nd factor: Ligament Sling - Radiocapitate ligament creates a sling on the scaphoid @jonesProjectFoundations2025 - 3rd factor: Tendon sling - FCR tendon forms a sling # Tilting movements @jonesProjectFoundations2025 # Scaphoid-lunate couple @jonesProjectFoundations2025 # Muscular attachments ::: {#tbl-scaphoid-insertion-oian .cell message='false' tbl-cap='Muscles inserting on the Scaphoid' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
``` ::: ::: ::: {#tbl-scaphoid-origin-oian .cell message='false' tbl-cap='Muscles originating from the Scaphoid' execution_count=2} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Abductor digiti minimi (hand) hand_flexor_retinaculum Base of 1st proximal phalanx (radial sesamoid) Median n.
C8 - T1		 CMC: Abduction
Abductor pollicis brevis Scaphoid
Trapezium
Flexor retinaculum		 1st proximal phalanx via radial sesamoid Median n.
C8 - T1		 CMC: Abduction
``` ::: ::: # Mobilization - Place your finger in the joint line between the radius and scaphoid. - Feel the movement as you move it into flexion and extension. ## Assess the scaphoid-trapezium - # Tests and Measures - [Scapholunate Shear Test]({{< var ref-scapholunate-shear-test.path >}})
